events.event_name: Bank of England Interest Rate Decision
events.description: The Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75% with a narrow 5-4 vote split.

events.event_name: Appointment of Peter Mandelson as UK ambassador to the US
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson as the UK ambassador to the US, leading to political scrutiny.

facts.fact_text: The British pound fell below $1.36, reaching its lowest point since January 22.

evidences.evidence_text: The British pound fell below $1.36, its weakest level since January 22

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England maintained interest rates at 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: the Bank of England left interest rates unchanged at 3.75%

facts.fact_text: The Monetary Policy Committee vote was split 5-4.

evidences.evidence_text: policymakers narrowly voting 5–4 in favor of keeping rates steady

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England's tone was more dovish than market expectations.

evidences.evidence_text: struck a more dovish tone than markets had anticipated

claims.claim_text: CPI inflation is projected to return to the 2% target beginning in April.
claims.author: Four MPC members

evidences.evidence_text: arguing that CPI inflation is expected to fall back towards the 2% target from April

claims.claim_text: Risks to the economy from weak demand and a loosening labor market are becoming more significant.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent

claims.claim_text: Political uncertainty regarding Keir Starmer's leadership is putting downward pressure on the pound.

evidences.evidence_text: Sterling was also pressured by rising political uncertainty, as questions emerged over the durability of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s leadership

links.source_ref: Bank of England Interest Rate Decision

evidence.evidence_text: Sterling Slides as BoE Turns More Dovish
Four MPC members backed an immediate 25 basis point cut... arguing that CPI inflation is expected to fall back towards the 2% target
downside risks linked to weaker demand and a loosening labor market have become more prominent
Sterling was also pressured by rising political uncertainty
